alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 10:50AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Blue Earth and southern Waseca Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1050 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mapleton, or 17 miles south of Mankato, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pemberton around 1055 AM CDT. Waldorf around 1105 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include New Richland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
